CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1953, pg. 15 reads: "Talking It Over - In attendance at the Pennsylvania Conference of American Women in Radio and Television last Saturday at the William Penn Hotel were the above group which included, left to right Edythe Meserand, New York CIty, former national president of AWRT; Alma Cramer, state conference chairman of Station WARD, Johnstown; Gertrude Trobe, co-chairman; Dolly Banks, manager Station WHAT, Philadelphia, and Mary Dee, WHOD, Homestead. Mary Dee was the first Negro woman to become a member of the organization. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of five members of the American Women in Radio and Television, left to right: Edythe Meserand, Alma Cramer, Gertrude Trobe, Dolly Banks, and Mary Dee, standing behind table in the WIlliam Penn Hotel for conference
